main_text:
In the philosophy of mind, externalism is the view that what
is going on in an individual’s mind is not (entirely) determined
by what is going on inside her body, including her brain. Externalism
comes in two principal forms: externalism about mental
content and externalism about the vehicles or bearers of that
content. The latter form of externalism is commonly known as the extended mind. At stake are important issues concerning the nature of the
mind and its relation to the world, both natural and social.
